Dan Smith

MPS, UXC

place Los Angeles, CA

Profile

Technical, creative, curious, user-centric problem solver

I'm driven to understand and optimize our human experience — especially how we interact with technology. As an empathetic technologist, I feel called to create ethical, accessible, thoughtful products and experiences that positively impact and enrich us.

I hold a master's degree in user experience design from the Maryland Institute College of Art, and have worked as a front-end engineer and UX designer for the past five years — most recently at Microsoft. I've also earned a UX certificate from the Nielsen Norman Group (certification ID #1015101), with over 78 hours of interaction design and UX research coursework thus far.

Outside of tech and design, I enjoy listening to and making music, traveling, and staying active. I love learning about languages, cultures, psychology, science, and interior design, to name a few.

Manifesto

I believe in:

  1. A continued commitment to growth, curiosity, and education
    1. Never being the smartest person in a room
    2. Humility – framing failure as a necessary step towards growth
  2. Intentionality, minimalism, efficiency, reducing “work” when possible
  3. Equitable emphasis on form and function
    1. Solid function earns validity; solid form earns trust
  4. Being able to entertain an idea without fully accepting it
    1. Working towards consciousness of biases and attachments
    2. Being open to the road less traveled
  5. Drawing inspiration from as many sources as possible; design is intrinsically interdisciplinary
    1. Lateral thinking; cultivating creativity through a balanced and full life
  6. Doing no harm – ethical, honest, inclusive, accessible, ergonomic design
  7. Reducing friction; returning valuable time to people, so that they can achieve their goals and focus on meaningful, fulfilling activities and relationships
  8. Appreciating and honoring that humans are interconnected and need one another to grow and thrive; using technology to further foster community

How can I help?
